title: MangaCard arrow positioning/color tweaks and decimal chapter progress display fix

requirements.summary: Adjust MangaCard title-cycle ArrowRight vertical translation so it renders 5px lower without affecting gutter layout alignment.
acceptanceCriteria: When alternate titles exist, the ArrowRight icon renders 5px lower than it currently does (relative to the card) while the rating block placement and alignment behavior remain unchanged.
When no alternate titles exist, the spacer element remains consistent with the arrow’s adjusted vertical position (so rating alignment does not shift between the two states).

file_operations.description: Update the title-cycle arrow button and its no-alternate-titles spacer to reduce the upward translateY amount by 5px (e.g., from -15px to -10px) while leaving the rating block translate and overall gutter layout behavior unchanged.

requirements.summary: Change MangaCard title-cycle ArrowRight icon color from green to a dark brown.
acceptanceCriteria: The ArrowRight icon is no longer rendered with a green Tailwind class and instead renders as a dark brown color that is clearly distinguishable from the previous green.

file_operations.description: Replace the ArrowRight icon’s green Tailwind color class with a dark brown color class (e.g., a dark amber/brown tone or an explicit hex via Tailwind arbitrary value), ensuring only the arrow color changes.

requirements.summary: Ensure chapter progress text renders decimal chapter values without truncation and keeps whole numbers free of unnecessary decimals.
acceptanceCriteria: If `manga.chaptersRead` is `104.5` and `manga.availableChapters` is `200`, the UI displays `104.5/200` (or equivalent that preserves the `.5`) in the chapter progress button text.
If both values are whole numbers (e.g., `104` and `200`), the UI displays them without unnecessary decimals (e.g., `104/200`).
Updating chapter progress with decimal inputs via the chapter progress popover persists and, after refresh/reload, the displayed value still includes the decimal portion (no truncation in display).

file_operations.description: Harden chapter-number formatting to preserve any fractional portion (no rounding/truncation) while trimming unnecessary trailing zeros for whole-number values (e.g., 200.0 -> "200", 104.5 -> "104.5").

Audit and adjust chapter progress rendering to ensure the displayed "chapters read/chapters available" text uses the non-truncating formatter output for both values, preserving decimals after edits and reloads.
